Class Move

java.lang.Object
  com.thoughtworks.robot.moves.Move
Direct Known Subclasses:
LeftMove, RightMove, StepMove
public abstract class Move
extends java.lang.Object

Base class that represents the Movement to be performed on Plateau.

Author:
sshinde
See Also:
LeftMove, RightMove, StepMove

          Purpose of this constructor with a MoveCode is to restrict the users to create only valid Move objects.

move

public abstract void move(Robot robot)
This method that must be implemented by individual Move classes for moving Robot.

Parameters:
robot - A Robot which needs to be moved on Plateau.

canMove

public abstract boolean canMove(java.util.Collection<Robot> allRobots,
                                Robot robot)
This method must be implemented by all other Move classes which are extending from this class. This method should be called before move(Robot robot) to check whether Robot can be moved to next Location or not? For example implementation please refer StepMove.

Parameters:
allRobots - all Robot(s) under a Robot controlling system/space.
robot -
Returns:
boolean Whether Robot can be moved to next Location or not?
See Also:
LeftMove, RightMove, StepMove
